About Me

Highly adaptable and self-motivated web developer who is enthusiastic for crafting beautiful and meaningful experiences. Passionately tackles new challenges with an open mind eager to continuously learn and grow. With the ability and experience to proficiently work using agile software and iterative test driven development/deployment, and pair programming practices.

  • 2015-Current

    Teaching Assistant

    Dev Bootcamp, San Francisco, CA

    Managed suppliers in all levels of unit hardware assembly and test while ensuring program cost and schedule goals are met over 6 programs. Successfully collaborated with multiple engineering disciplines and suppliers to develop, negotiate, and write component technical specifications and test requirements based on system needs.

  • 2015

    Web Development Studuent

    Dev Bootcamp, San Francisco, CA

    Completed a 19-week intensive training program specializing in Ruby, Rails, HTML5, CSS, TDD, Object-Oriented Javascript (JQuery, AJAX), Git, Heroku, and Agile Development.

  • 2012-Current

    Electrical Product Engineer

    Space Systems Loral, Palo Alto, CA

    Managed suppliers in all levels of unit hardware assembly and test while ensuring program cost and schedule goals are met over 6 programs. Successfully collaborated with multiple engineering disciplines and suppliers to develop, negotiate, and write component technical specifications and test requirements based on system needs.

  • 2010

    Research Assistant

    Purdue University, West Lafayette, IN

    Researched and delivered technical report of a Micro-Electro-Mechanical Systems (MEMS) lung pressure sensor by designing a concentric capacitive comb drive using COMSOL Multiphysics software.

  • 2007-2011

    Purdue University, West Lafayette, IN

    Graduated from Purdue University with a B.S. degree in Electrical Engineering from the College of Engineering

Cross-Check

Cross-Check allows the users to look up the nearest ice hockey rink in Northern California and provides a list of hockey coaches for that particular hockey rink. Additionally, coaches can create a profile and add their experience and contact info for hockey players who are looking to start playing ice hockey or refine their skills. Cross-Check was engineered in Ruby with Sinatra, and using the Google Maps API.

  • Date: April 2015
  • Service: Web Development

GoT (Game of Thrones) Faker

GoT Faker is a Ruby gem to generate fake Game of Thrones data.

  • Date: April 2015
  • Service: Web Development

Intergalactic VR

Intergalactic VR is a virtual reality experience for for iOS/Android and Google Cardboard. The experience takes you on a virtual reality tour of a facility with a car garage, and into space displaying an audio visualizer completely created with 3D objects.Intergalactic VR was engineered in JavaScript with Three.js, WebGL, and Web Audio API.

  • Date: April 2015
  • Service: Web Development
